channel.title: Does Moparscape clients works on Vista?
channel.description:
I am using VISTA on my laptop and I was wondering if all those 508, 525, 544+ Clients working for VISTA too? I have downloaded more then 10 Clients (each different Servers) and none work (the Clients don't work).
Know how to solve this problem? :confused:
Then please post a comment on how to solve it!
Image what it looks like when I open a 508 client: http://i628.photobucket.com/albums/uu2/kingdad38/508doesnotworl.png
Tyvm, Cezaking

@B2300_T4nk wrote:

Run.bat. Wow, you were running 508 on a 317 Client?

Read full topic

item.title: Does Moparscape clients works on Vista?
item.dc:creator: @cezaking cezaking
item.description:
@cezaking wrote:

I thank all of you for helping me out of this problem.
As I failed many times to play on one of the 508 Clients, i came to a conclusen.

Conclusen: Not putting anymore efford in it.

Again, thanks alot for your help guys! I will never be able to understand how to acces a 508 Client

Tyvm,
Cezaking

item.title: Does Moparscape clients works on Vista?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“cezaking, post:14, topic:308332”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=404573.msg2996148#msg2996148 date=1255618165]
Just go download one from server downloads and run it, damn.
[/quote]
I did what you told me to and let me explain what I exectly did;

o Downloaded http://www.mediafire.com/?acd0b730n49 from http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,372819.0.html
o Extraced to folder
o Josem731 v2 uploaded by I Die Hard I > Run

And this is what I get:
‘‘The system can not find the path specified’’
‘‘The system can not find the path specified’’
‘‘press any key to continue…’’

I did what you said I should do, but I guess i missed a part?

Tyvm,
Cezaking[/quote]

Edit the java version in the run.bat or the compile.bat, which ever you pressed.

Read full topic

item.title: Does Moparscape clients works on Vista?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Download a 525 server, press run.bat.

And, if the cache is contained within the client, don’t move it?
If it’s contained with the client, then it probably runs from that location specified, not from your C:/Windows/…

Read full topic
item.source: Does Moparscape clients works on Vista?

item.title: Does Moparscape clients works on Vista?
item.dc:creator: @cezaking cezaking
item.description:
@cezaking wrote:

B2300 T4nk:

No. It means the run.bat in the server folder.

No idea what you mean.

I have downloaded ‘‘RevengeScape Clients’’ and when I open it, there’s a cache525 in it. I’ve put that in C:/Windows.
When I dubble click on the ‘‘RevengeScape’’ client (in order to run it), it stays at ‘‘RevengeScape is loading - please wait…’’ ‘‘Connecting to update server’’.

For real… I don’t get this and it’s getting very agitated

Tyvm,
Cezaking

Read full topic

item.title: Does Moparscape clients works on Vista?
item.dc:creator: @cezaking cezaking
item.description:
@cezaking wrote:

Again, thank you for replying SilentCJ

You said ‘‘The server must be started before’’ - Do you mean the client it self?
I’m guessing it’s not, in that case… Where can I find the server & how to start it up?

NOTE: I don’t know anything about servers/clients, so please do understand that everything you will explain to me… you might have to do it twice

Tyvm,
Cezaking

Read full topic

item.title: Does Moparscape clients works on Vista?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“cezaking, post:3, topic:308332”]Thank you for replying

I took you advice and downloaded the latest version of Java, but it’s still not working some how…
When the client is running, it shows the following; ‘‘Runescape is loading - please wair…’’ & below in the red box ‘‘Connecting to update server’’.
It might be that it should be cache, but again… I have no idea on how to cache it.

Hoping to hear from you (SilentCJ) or anyone else soon!

Tyvm,
Cezaking[/quote]

Have you got the server running?
The server must be started before, and make sure it is compatible to that specific client.

Read full topic
